modes.notes: 6 tram routes serving the city. Tram line 1 carries the largest passenger volume.
52 bus routes including route 22 to/from Riga International Airport (€1.81, accepts bank card payment from driver)

payment_methods.details: €1.50. Valid for 90 minutes with transfers between tram, trolleybus, and bus. Must be registered each time boarding a new vehicle.
€5.00. Unlimited travel on all public transport for 24 hours.
Reloadable card purchased at vendors or online. Can be topped up at kiosks or through online recharge.

operating_hours.night_service: Summer season weekends and public holidays: three dedicated night bus routes (N1, N4, N6) operate hourly from midnight to 4:00 AM from city centre

rideshare.notes: Mobile app available for taxi and private driver requests. Pre-ordering recommended for better fares.

tips: Purchase a 3-day or 5-day ticket for optimal value during a 2-5 day stay. All tickets must be registered each time you board a different vehicle. Tickets available at vending machines, Narvesen kiosks, Rīgas satiksme customer service centres, and mobile apps. Penalty for invalid ticket: €15-€30. Download Rīgas Satiksme or Trafi app for offline route planning and real-time schedules. Note: Official website may be inaccessible from non-EU servers due to cyber-attack protections.
